body: Hi, I was a staff member on mczone/Avicus for just under two years from the end of 2012 - the end of 2014. I was involved in the senior staff for over a year. I haven't logged in for quite a while and am willing to answer any question you may have for me across any topic.
body_tagged: Hi, I was a staff member on mczone/Avicus for just under two years from the end of 2012 - the end of 2014. I was involved in the senior staff for over a year. I haven't logged in for quite a while and am willing to answer any question you may have for me across any topic.
title: AMA The_Detonator_

replies.body: Yes, I keep up on computer components, usually have a pretty good idea of what components go with what and recently "built" a computer from mostly second hand parts which runs bf4 60 fps on medium settings (sub $200 inc monitor).

replies.body: Big question to ask. I got into running last year, specializing in middle distance, also did a lot of weightlifting. Lost a good amount of weight in fat, grew it back in mostly muscle, and in the last month have stopped running and taking up cycling as my main sport. As for gaming, stopped playing for a while until I built my PC, and have recently been hanging out on bf4 and occasionally csgo.
replies.body_tagged: Big question to ask. I got into running last year, specializing in middle distance, also did a lot of weightlifting. Lost a good amount of weight in fat, grew it back in mostly muscle, and in the last month have stopped running and taking up cycling as my main sport. As for gaming, stopped playing for a while until I built my PC, and have recently been hanging out on bf4 and occasionally csgo.

replies.body:
Opinions on this build? http://pcpartpicker.com/list/Y8hbsY

I will just use the stock fan that comes with intel processors as I can't overclock this. I will probably also get a 500w power supply opposed too an 750w as I don't need it.
